elements.name: #TC1 :
elements.description:
Verify that when a GET request with valid authorization information and correct data (id)
  is sent to the 'user/ticket/detail/{{id}}' endpoint, the returned status code is 200, and the success
  information in the response body is "true"

steps.name: The API user sets "user/ticket/detail/161" path parameters
The API user saves the response from the user ticket detail endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 200
The API user verifies that the success attribute in the response body is true

elements.name: #TC2 :
elements.description:
Verify that when a GET request with valid authorization information and lacking the 'id' is sent
  to the 'user/ticket/detail/{{id}}' endpoint, the returned status code is 203, and the message information
  in the response body is "No id"

steps.name: The API user sets "user/ticket/detail" path parameters
The API user saves the response from the user ticket detail endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 203
The API User verifies that the message information in the response body is "No id"

elements.name: #TC3 :
elements.description:
Verify that when a GET request with valid authorization information and containing an (id)
  that does not exist in the records is sent to the 'user/ticket/detail/{{id}}' endpoint, the returned status
  code is 203, and the message information in the response body is "No ticket."

steps.name: The API user sets "user/ticket/detail/777" path parameters
The API user saves the response from the user ticket detail endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 203
The API User verifies that the message information in the response body is "No ticket."

elements.name: #TC4 :
elements.description:
Verify that when a GET request with invalid authorization information is sent to the
  'user/ticket/detail/{{id}}' endpoint, the returned status code is 401, and the error message in the
  response body is "Unauthorized request"

steps.name: The API user sets "user/ticket/detail/161" path parameters
The API user records the response with invalid authorization information, verifies that the status code is '401' and confirms that the error information is Unauthorized

elements.name: #TC5 :
elements.description:
The contents of the data (id, user_id, name, email, ticket, subject, status, priority,
  last_reply, created_at, updated_at) within the response body should be verified

steps.name: The API user sets "user/ticket/detail/161" path parameters
The API user saves the response from the user ticket detail endpoint with valid authorization information

The API user verifies that the content of the data field in the response body includes 161, 19, "beyza nergiz", "beyzanergiz@gmail.com", "687946", "Test Ticket", 0, 0, "2023-12-28 02:16:39", "2023-12-28T07:16:39.000000Z", "2023-12-28T07:16:39.000000Z"

name: As a user, I want to access the ticket details of a specified user through the API connection using their ID.

elements.name: When a POST request with valid authorization information and correct data (subject, priority, message)
elements.description:
is sent to the user/ticket/add endpoint, the returned status code should be 200, and the message in the response
 body should be verified as "Ticket opened successfully!"

steps.name: The API user sets "user/ticket/add" path parameters
The API user prepares a POST request containing the correct data to send to the user ticket add endpoint
The API user sends a POST request and saves the response from the user ticket add endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 200
The API user verifies that the message information in the response body is "Ticket opened successfully!"

elements.name: When a POST request with valid authorization information and no data (subject, priority, message)
elements.description:
is sent to the user/ticket/add endpoint, the returned status code should be 203, and the remark in the response
 body should be verified as "failed"

steps.name: The API user sets "user/ticket/add" path parameters
The API user prepares a POST request without data to send to the user ticket add endpoint
The API user sends a POST request and saves the response from the user ticket add endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 203
The API user verifies that the remark information in the response body is "failed"

elements.name: When a POST request with valid authorization information and incomplete missing data
elements.description:
(priority,message) is sent to the user/ticket/add endpoint, the returned status code should be 203,
 and the remark in the response body should be verified as "failed"

steps.name: The API user sets "user/ticket/add" path parameters
The API user prepares a POST request with missing data to send to the user ticket add endpoint.
The API user sends a POST request and saves the response from the user ticket add endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 203
The API user verifies that the remark information in the response body is "failed"

elements.name: Verify that when a POST request with invalid authorization information and correct data
elements.description:
(subject, priority, message) is sent to the 'user/ticket/add' endpoint, the returned status code is 401,
 and the error message in the response body is "Unauthorized request"

steps.name: The API user sets "user/ticket/add" path parameters
The API user prepares a POST request containing the correct data to send to the user ticket add endpoint
The API user sends a POST request and saves the response from the user ticket add endpoint with invalid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 401
The API user verifies that the error information in the response body is "Unauthorized request"

elements.name: The creation of a new ticket record intended to be generated through the API should be
elements.description:
verified. This can be confirmed by sending a GET request to the 'user/ticket/detail/{{id}}' endpoint with
 the Opened ticked id returned in the response body, thus validating that the record has been created

steps.name: The API user sets "user/ticket/detail/450" path parameters
The API user saves the response from the user ticket detail endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 200
The API user verifies that the success attribute in the response body is true
The API user verifies that the id information in the response body is 450

name: As a user, I want to be able to create a new user ticket record through API connection.

elements.name: In each scenario, the user must first set path parameters.

steps.name: The API user sets "user/profile" path parameters

elements.name: When a PATCH request with valid authorization information and correct data
elements.description:
(firstname, lastname, address, state, zip, city) is sent to the user/profile endpoint,
    the returned status code should be 200, and the message in the response body should be verified as "Profile updated successfully"

steps.name: The API user prepares a PATCH request containing the correct data to send to the user profile endpoint
The API user saves the response from the user profile endpoint with admin valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 200
The API user verifies that the message information in the response body is "Profile updated successfully"

elements.name: In each scenario, the user must first set path parameters.

steps.name: The API user sets "user/profile" path parameters

elements.name: Verify that when a PATCH request with valid authorization information and
elements.description:
incomplete data (address, state, zip, city) is sent to the 'user/profile' endpoint,
      the returned status code is 203, and the remark information in the response body is "failed"

steps.name: The API user prepares a PATCH request containing the incomplete data to send to the user profile endpoint
The API user saves the response from the user profile endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 203
The API user verifies that the remark information in the response body is "failed"

elements.name: In each scenario, the user must first set path parameters.

steps.name: The API user sets "user/profile" path parameters

elements.name: Verify that when a PATCH request with valid authorization information
elements.description:
and an empty body (firstname, lastname, address, state, zip, city) is sent to
        the 'user/profile' endpoint, the returned status code is 203, and the remark information in the response body is "failed"

steps.name: The API user prepares a PATCH request containing the without data to send to the user profile endpoint
The API user saves the response from the user profile endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 203
The API user verifies that the remark information in the response body is "failed"

elements.name: In each scenario, the user must first set path parameters.

steps.name: The API user sets "user/profile" path parameters

elements.name: Verify that when a PATCH request with invalid authorization information and
elements.description:
correct data (firstname, lastname, address, state, zip, city) is sent to the 'user/profile' endpoint,
          the returned status code is 401, and the error message in the response body is "Unauthorized request"

steps.name: The API user prepares a PATCH request containing the correct data to send to the user profile endpoint
The API user saves the response from the user profile endpoint with invalid authorization information and verifies that the status code is '401' and the error message is Unauthorized

name: As a user, I want to be able to update the user profile information in the system through API connection.

elements.name: TC01: When a valid POST request with appropriate authorization credentials, correct data (email),
elements.description:
and the right (id) is sent to the 'api/subscriber/update/{{id}}' endpoint, it should return a status code of 200,
  and the message in the response body should be "Subscriber updated successfully"

steps.name: The API user sets "api/subscriber/update/185" path parameters
The API user prepares a POST request containing the correct data to send to the subscriber update endpoint
The API user sends a POST request and saves the response from the subscriber update endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 200
The API user verifies that the message information in the subscriber response body is "Subscriber updated successfully"

elements.name: TC02: When a valid POST request with appropriate authorization credentials, correct (id), and an
elements.description:
empty data (email) in the body is sent to the 'api/subscriber/update/{{id}}' endpoint, it should return a
  status code of 203, and the remark in the response body should be "failed"

steps.name: The API user sets "api/subscriber/update/<id>" path parameters
The API user prepares a POST request without data to send to the subscriber update endpoint
The API user sends a POST request and saves the response from the subscriber update endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 203
The API user verifies that the remark information in the response body is "failed"

elements.name: TC03: When a valid POST request with appropriate authorization credentials, correct (id), and incorrect data
elements.description:
(mail) is sent to the 'api/subscriber/update/{{id}}' endpoint, it should return a status code of 203, and the remark
  in the response body should be "failed"

steps.name: The API user sets "api/subscriber/update/<id>" path parameters
The API user prepares a POST request incorrect data to send to the subscriber update endpoint
The API user sends a POST request and saves the response from the subscriber update endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 203
The API user verifies that the remark information in the response body is "failed"

elements.name: TC04: When a POST request with valid authorization credentials and an empty (id) in the body
elements.description:
(email) is sent to the 'api/subscriber/update/{{id}}' endpoint, it should return a status code of 203,
  and the message in the response body should be "No id."

steps.name: The API user sets "api/subscriber/update" path parameters
The API user prepares a POST request containing the correct data to send to the subscriber update endpoint
The API user sends a POST request and saves the response from the subscriber update endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 203
The API user verifies that the message information in the subscriber response body is "No id."

elements.name: TC05: When a POST request with valid authorization credentials and an (id) that does not correspond
elements.description:
to an existing record is sent to the 'api/subscriber/update/{{id}}' endpoint, it should return a status code of 203,
  and the message in the response body should be "There is no subscriber with this id to be updated"

steps.name: The API user sets "api/subscriber/update/<id>" path parameters
The API user prepares a POST request containing the correct data to send to the subscriber update endpoint
The API user sends a POST request and saves the response from the subscriber update endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 203
The API user verifies that the message information in the subscriber response body is "There is no subscriber with this id to be updated"

arguments.val: "There is no subscriber with this id to be updated"

elements.name: TC06: When an invalid POST request with unauthorized credentials, correct (id), and a body containing
elements.description:
data (email) is sent to the 'api/subscriber/update/{{id}}' endpoint, it should return a status code of 401, and
  the error message in the response body should be "Unauthorized request"

steps.name: The API user sets "api/subscriber/update/<id>" path parameters
The API user prepares a POST request containing the correct data to send to the subscriber update endpoint
The API user sends a POST request and saves the response from the subscriber update endpoint with invalid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 401
The API user verifies that the error information in the response body is "Unauthorized request"

elements.name: TC07: The update of the desired subscriber record via API should be confirmed by sending a GET request
elements.description:
to the 'api/subscriber/details/{{id}}' endpoint with the 'updated subscriber id' obtained from the response body.
  This verification process ensures that the record has been successfully updated

steps.name: The API user sets "api/subscriber/details/185" path parameters
The API user saves the response from the subscriber update endpoint with valid authorization information
The API user verifies that the status code is 200
The API user verifies that the id information in the response body is 185

name: As an administrator, I want to update the existing subscriber information via API connection.
